results.title: Warsaw, a socialist city. - Program 1: planning
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, Open University and BBC
results.brief_description: In socialist centres, planners are able to evolve and implement their plans unhindered by market prices. Warsaw, which was almost completely destroyed during World War 2, provided an opportunity for the planners to give complete expression to their aims. The film shows how the planners overcame problems of radical transformations of the town, with reconstruction and restoration of the most valuable historical and architectural groupings.

results.title: Warrnambool
results.creator_credit: John Porter and Eric Porter Productions
results.brief_description: Starting with aerial shots of the ‘12 Apostles’, ‘London Bridge’ and other rugged limestone structures along Victoria’s south-western coast, this travelogue documentary about Warrnambool highlights the town’s tourist opportunities, the people and the business centre for the wealthy agricultural dairying district. Includes footage of ‘Lady Bay’, the botanic gardens, the annual steeplechase and the Fletcher Jones and Nestle factories. Written by James Jeffrey, photographed by Gary Hansen.

results.title: Warriors and dancers
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Narjiic Day-Burns
results.brief_description:
Narjiic’s passion for music and dance began in Year 10 when he was asked to perform for NAIDOC Week. From there he joined various dance groups performing all over Victoria including his home town Echuca, finally enrolling at Swinburne. Today he blends a fusion of traditional dance with hip-hop as a way of expressing his thoughts and emotions. Dance has become a part of his life.
Music by Fonetik.

results.title: Warriors
results.creator_credit: Richard Guthrie, Commonwealth Dept of Aboriginal Affairs and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Rainbow serpent”.
Bob Maza and Eric Willmot, author of an unpublished novel on the exploits of Pemulwuy, who led resistance to the British colonisation of Australia, discuss the role that Pemulwuy and other Aboriginal warriors played in the early years of the British colony of Australia. Their guerrilla and confrontational tactics are contrasted with those of Bennelong, who sought some form of reconciliation. The program includes dramatised enactments of some of these events.

results.title: Warrior women
results.creator_credit: Christine Gillespie, Generation Films, Jacqui Ward, Michael Buckley and Sue Smith
results.brief_description:
The Warrior Women CDROM and booklet evolved out of the Warrior Women Exhibiiton. Warrior Women is a moving, insightful and innovative mixed media art exhibiiton created by women exploring their experiences of breast cancer. Women of all ages, cultural and social backgrounds collaborated with women artists to develop this significant exhibition. The collaborations took place over a two year period and resulted in over 100 pieces of art including videos, projections, audio, slides, photographs, digital designs and writing.

The Australia Council for the Arts funded the redevelopment of the Warrior Women Exhibition artworks into a booklet and an interactive CDROM. These were distributed throughout Australia by the Breast Cancer Network, Australia.

results.title: Warren Beatty
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Warren Beatty’s reputation as a great romantic figure both on and off the screen has enthralled audiences throughout his career. Using rare film clips, production stills and coming attraction trailers this video provides an insight into his performances as an actor and his efforts as a producer and director. Also presents information about his personal life highlighting his more famous romantic encounters.

results.title: Warrah
results.brief_description: Warrah was filmed in the coastal sandstone bush of the Hawkesbury River area in NSW. It is a film of rock, foliage, angophoras, rock pools, the movement of shadows, light reflected from water and reflections of trees and clouds in rock pools. The soundtrack of this 3-colour separation film is an unaltered recording of insects and choruses of kookaburras.

results.title: Warping mill
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Weaving”.
Shows how weaving warps that are longer that six metres in length can be made on a warping mill.
